title: UC-247 • The Offline Conversion Feedback to Ad Platforms • The Group Event Organizer (Gathering Gwen)
description: Comprehensive lifecycle saga derived from UC-247 and persona P-43. Needs summary: Conversion event records with source click lineage; Outbound delivery queue with retries/dead-letter handling; Status timeline per conversion push; Idempotent dedupe for repeated sends; Support for partial/adjusted conversion value updates
objectives: Validate UC-247 lifecycle end-to-end using persona The Group Event Organizer (Gathering Gwen).
Exercise owner setup, team setup, catalog publishing, and customer journeys.
Stress ACL/security edge cases and verify expected denials are enforced.
Collect snapshots and report artifacts for every critical milestone.

actors.name: The Group Event Organizer (Gathering Gwen)
actors.description: Books multiple people for same event/time slot

actors.name: Operations Team Member
actors.description: Business member invited by owner to assist with operations and booking flow.

actors.name: Customer One
actors.description: Primary customer exploring catalog, booking services, and purchasing products.

actors.name: Customer Two
actors.description: Concurrent customer used to simulate realistic demand and race conditions.

actors.name: Adversarial User
actors.description: Actor intentionally attempting unauthorized or abusive actions.

phases.title: Owner Onboarding
phases.description: Business owner signs up, authenticates, and establishes tenant root.

steps.title: Owner signs up and authenticates
steps.intent: Establish authenticated owner identity for the lifecycle.
steps.instruction: Create or login the owner account through Better Auth endpoints, then verify session context can call authenticated API routes.
steps.expectedResult: Owner session exists and authenticated routes return success for this user.

assertions.description: API call returns success and includes stable ids for created entities.
Actor permissions are honored for this step context.

evidenceRequired.label: Request/response trace for this step
Structured snapshot.v1 screen blocks (what user saw) with real API-backed data

steps.title: Owner creates business tenant
steps.intent: Create the biz root for all subsequent configuration.
steps.instruction: Using agents tools, create a biz representing The Offline Conversion Feedback to Ad Platforms. Use name/slug derived from saga context.
steps.expectedResult: Biz is created, owner is auto-added as member with owner role, and biz id is captured.

phases.title: Business Configuration
phases.description: Owner configures scheduling, pricing baseline, and operational defaults.

steps.intent: Set baseline availability without forcing advanced complexity.
steps.instruction: Create baseline availability and lead-time rules representing the UC default business hours and booking window behavior.
steps.expectedResult: Availability defaults and rules are stored and can be referenced by calendars.

phases.title: Security And Abuse Checks
phases.description: Adversarial actor attempts prohibited operations to validate access controls.

steps.title: Adversary attempts unauthorized cross-biz read
steps.intent: Validate tenant isolation against IDOR-like behavior.
steps.instruction: Using credentials from another context, attempt to read or mutate booking/order resources for this biz.
steps.expectedResult: Request is rejected with forbidden/unauthorized error and no data leakage.

assertions.description: API call returns success and includes stable ids for created entities.
Actor permissions are honored for this step context.

Structured snapshot.v1 screen blocks (what user saw) with real API-backed data

guardrails: No sensitive payload should be returned

steps.title: Adversary attempts demand/hold abuse
steps.intent: Stress anti-abuse controls around booking intent and capacity locks.
steps.instruction: Trigger repeated booking/hold-like attempts to validate throttling, expiry, or non-blocking demand visibility behavior.

metadata.ucScenario: A premium booking closes after manual approval 3 days post-lead. System sends offline conversion value back to Google Ads and Meta CAPI, improving optimization on actual closed revenue instead of just clicks.
metadata.personaPainPoints: Partial group cancellations, individual attendee changes, deposit handling
